results.title: Israel’s Pager Attack Has No Clear Strategic Goal, Analysts Say
results.abstract: By targeting so many pagers at the same time, Israel demonstrated technical prowess. But its long-term intent is unclear.

multimedia.caption: Inspecting a car in which a pager exploded in Beirut on Tuesday.
Inspecting a car in which a pager exploded in Beirut on Tuesday.
Inspecting a car in which a pager exploded in Beirut on Tuesday.

results.title: Pager Attacks Embarrass Hezbollah but May Not Deter It, Analysts Say
results.abstract: The armed group’s history suggests that the attacks targeting its pagers will not cause it to change course or seek an accommodation with Israel.

multimedia.caption: Outside the American University of Beirut Hospital on Tuesday, where many people injured in Tuesday’s attack were taken.

results.title: Fed Officials Are Expected to Cut Rates. The Question Is How Much.
results.abstract: Policymakers are expected to lower rates for the first time in four years on Wednesday while releasing fresh economic forecasts.

multimedia.caption: Federal Reserve Chair Jerome H. Powell in June. Investors are betting the Fed will cut rates either a quarter or half percentage point.

results.title: Wall Street Has Its Eye on a Big Rate Cut
results.abstract: The S&P 500 is hovering just below record territory, driven by a revived rally as bets have grown that the Federal Reserve will cut interest rates by half a percentage point.

results.title: A Fed Rate Cut Would Cap a Winning Streak for Biden and Harris on Prices
results.abstract: Improved data on borrowing costs and price growth has buoyed consumers, but it might be coming too late to significantly affect the presidential race

results.title: Sean Combs’s New Home: A Troubled Brooklyn Jail
results.abstract: The music mogul, who is charged with sex trafficking and racketeering conspiracy, was denied bail and ordered held at a federal detention center. His lawyers are appealing.
results.byline: By Julia Jacobs and Ben Sisario

multimedia.caption: Jailed defendants like Sean Combs who are awaiting trial on federal charges are typically housed at the Metropolitan Detention Center in Brooklyn, which has been criticized for poor conditions.
Jailed defendants like Sean Combs who are awaiting trial on federal charges are typically housed at the Metropolitan Detention Center in Brooklyn, which has been criticized for poor conditions.

results.title: Sean Combs Is Denied Bail on Sex Trafficking and Racketeering Charges
results.abstract: A day after his arrest, the music mogul known as Diddy was accused of running a “criminal enterprise” that threatened and abused women. He pleaded not guilty.
results.byline: By Ben Sisario and Julia Jacobs

multimedia.caption: Sean Combs was arrested in New York on Monday night, several months after federal agents raided his homes in Los Angeles and Miami Beach.
Sean Combs was arrested in New York on Monday night, several months after federal agents raided his homes in Los Angeles and Miami Beach.

results.title: Far From Ohio, Haitian Americans Feel the Sting of Threats in Springfield
results.abstract: They charged Donald J. Trump and JD Vance, who spread baseless rumors that Haitians in an Ohio city were eating pets, with imperiling their community for political gain.

multimedia.caption: “It may seem like just politics,” said Karl Racine, who served two terms as attorney general for the District of Columbia and immigrated to the United States from Haiti when he was 6. “But it’s serious business, with the real possibility of violence.”
multimedia.copyright: Alyssa Schukar for The New York Times

results.title: Trump, Hardly New York’s Favorite Son, Brings His Message to Long Island
results.abstract: Donald J. Trump’s rally in Nassau County on Wednesday is another sign of the area’s shift to the right, but some question his choice to spend time in a non-battleground state.

multimedia.caption: Former President Donald J. Trump says he has a “real chance” of winning New York, even as recent polls show him no closer than 14 percentage points behind Vice President Kamala Harris.

results.title: Trump Tries to Close Off a Chief Line of Attack: That He’s a Danger to Democracy
results.abstract: Donald Trump has tried to link Democrats’ charge that he poses a “threat to democracy” to threats on his life. Meanwhile, he has heightened his own attacks on his rivals.

multimedia.caption: “Their rhetoric is causing me to be shot at, when I am the one who is going to save the country,” Mr. Trump said in an interview with Fox News Digital.

results.title: Second Apparent Assassination Attempt on Trump Prompts Alarm Abroad
results.abstract: There is widespread concern that the November election will not end well and that American democracy has frayed to the breaking point.

results.title: Russia Seizes Eastern Town as Ukraine Says It Hit a Big Ammunition Depot

results.title: These Four Common Infections Can Cause Cancer
results.abstract: A new report says that 13 percent of cancers are linked to bacteria or viruses. Vaccines and treatments offer powerful protection.

results.title: Flooding in Central Europe a ‘Clear Reminder’ of the Threat of Extreme Weather

results.title: Phaedra Parks’s Diamond Bracelet
